alert.note: Alert for Fall River County Area; Southern Black Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 19 at 2:55AM MDT until September 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .Unseasonably warm temperatures are expected today. Minimum relative humidity will be around 15 percent for much of the area...with portions of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota dropping to near 10 percent. Deep boundary layer mixing will result in gusty west-southwest winds this afternoon/early evening. Wind gusts over 30 mph are possible for much of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota. While winds decrease this evening, relative humidity will be slow to recover this evening/tonight; maximum relative for areas around the Black Hills will be 45 percent or less. A cold front slides through the area tonight/early Tuesday with a period of gusty northwest winds behind the front. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 321, AND 322... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains, 317 Weston County Plains, 321 Southern Black Hills and 322 Fall River County Area. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts around 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Fall River County Area; Southern Black Hills
